Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hot Mess”
Reviews.Author: Minala H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hot mess, scam artists. This hotel has no star at all, the employees were rude, no internet in the rooms, no towels, no tissue, no toilet paper, no iron the bed squeks and the bedsheets don't fit. The tv does not have local channels therefore you cannot even know the weather. When I called for an iron we waited for 1 hour, and from then they were not answering the phone, anyway the iron NEVER CAME. Something need to be done this is terrible. Don't even try to stay here I wish I read the review before I booked through hotel.com. I am so dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and you can be stolen!!!”
Reviews.Author: Igor A
Reviews.Content: Bad neighborhood, difficult to find, and if you leave the car unlocked, even with the window closed, you will be stolen. In just one hour this happens to me. They told me the security guy work just to check the cars, and the Hotel are not responsible for thefts. Yes, I was stolen in just one hour, with a security guy working and only 3 cars in the parking lot. Don't recommend to anybody!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Scam artists”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: First time I ever been scammed at a hotel. First of all this hotel is a bad area and I had bad vibe when going in. Very old and ugly, motels are much nicer...I walk in and show my reservation papers and they say I'm not in the system. The guys do not seem to know what they are doing...I was there waiting for 2 hours, we were on the phone with cheapostay, finally they receive fax with the order. Instead of the "suite" I purchased they wanted to give me a standard room. I said no here is my order with the suite I ordered... Next they tell me ok fine we will give you the suite, but you have to pay. I already stated I paid and here is the paperwork and receipt of payment, they tell me to call cheapostay again...I shouldn't even be calling since they are the ones with the errors...I ended up leaving as it would of taken 3 hours and it was already 11pm...After finally talking with cheapostay, I tell them I left and I want my refund. They agreed and I was only charged 10 dollars until I stayed, then the rest would be charged. I look at my account the next day and the hotel charged me 97.18! Called cheapostay and there is an investigation with the hotel. I will be reporting to my credit card as well. Stay away from this dirty and ugly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hott mess hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Indiaizit
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent the weekend there on a short notice trip to miami. The lighting sucked had to do my makeup in the bathroom. The water was cold.we had to wait any hour for an iron. There were lizards,the comforters had holes in them and the sheets reeked an unpleasant odor. Never ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: lanette j
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed here about a mounth ago and I was so afraid that I set up all night and watched my kids sleep. They had good customer service but the hotel was terrible. So they really had to be nice.Then we ordered pizza and the delivery guy trust to ASK for a tip. That added fuel to the fire. Please take this advice and that of others about there horrible experience. $100/night PLEASE more like $10/night.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you might think”
Reviews.Author: Joy B
Reviews.Content: First off, I was literally scared to death to stay here after I read the reviews. I called the hotel and spoke to a nice gentleman and explained my concern. He said "Most people say it is not as bad as they thought it would be". This did not help my fear. But, let me also say this, it was not as bad as I thought. We stayed here one night prior to leaving for our cruise. The room was clean, the bed was clean, the bathroom was clean. We were there less than 12 hours and felt that we got what we paid for at $55. The staff was friendly, and I did not feel uneasy. Would I want to stay here for longer than one night? No, of course not, but to sleep and shower it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Spend The Night Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aida S
Reviews.Content: Please listen to other review's about this rat dive. This is the most disgusting, scariest place that i've ever been. The restroom sink was held up by a 2x4 and teh beds were old and smelly. The box spring was broken. It smelled like mildew, and marijuana. It was a nightmare. We walked and and checked out the same night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Roma Golden Glades Resort”
Reviews.Author: alsa7ab
Reviews.Content: Lived in this hotel 4 days did not like the lack of a refrigerator and microwave and satellite channels are limited The hotel has a difficult access, far from the beach and services such as commercial markets

Reviews.Title: “this place needs GOD”
Reviews.Author: johndoe07
Reviews.Content: This place sucks, call it the crap-tastic hotel from h@#LL. I stayed here for some time and was nice to everyone. But did not get the same treatment. Rooms suck, there moldy. a/c is moldy. Beds are not made with clean sheets; they remake the bed with the sheets youâ€™ve been sleeping on. Cars get broken into while guess are in rooms sleep. No camera works so thatâ€™s what makes it easy to have your car vandalized. Ice machine is broken, tv have bad channels. Wi-Fi is only in lobby. Canâ€™t enjoy your laptop in your room. You wanna stay here do it at your own risk, TWO THUMBS DOWN, AND IF I HAD FOUR THEY WOULD ALL BE DOWN.

Reviews.Title: “The worst and most disgusting night of my life!”
Reviews.Author: FrancyBellew
Reviews.Content: There's was pooh stains on the matters, blood stains on the carpet, the beds made me feel itchy! Burn marks on the carpet too! The carpet smelt of wet dogs and the ice machines didn't work! We asked reception about somewhere nice to eat and we were told there was a subway across the car park! It said it was within walking distance of Sun Life Stadium but it took 2 hours and was seven miles! I got a cola out of the vending machine and noticed it went flat very quickly on examining the expiry date it was 2 months out of date! I didn't complain as I feared what would happen to me if I did! My wife and I showered with our socks on and threw out the pyjamas we wore! On the way out a man was at reception with a prostitute trying to hire a room for an hour, the prostitute still had a large rubber band from shooting up presumably moments earlier! STEER AS CLEAR OF THIS RAT HOLE AND DIVE AS IF YOUR LIFE DEPENDED ON IT BECAUSE IT PROBABLY DOES!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Missy4470
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel. Beds were squeaky boards, not to mention they had roaches running in the drawers. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do non-refundable, you'll be sorry”
Reviews.Author: Sadface11
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous customer, back up and get out there as fast as you can. If you need a place to just go to sleep, this is your place it really belongs in the middle of nowhere on the side of a highway because you would pass directly past it without a second look. it is a relic of a past era, maybe a Great place once upo a time. I wish I had read reviews prior to traveling to Miami and staying here, trip advisor had us pay a non- refundable fee and that it the ONLY reason I stayed there. When I told the manager I wanted to get my money back at check in, he said I had booked on line and could not get my money back in a sly chuckling kind of way. I told him then that I would write a bad review about his business. Rooms were old and smelly, a/c was unplugged and moldy, lamp shades torn, bad tv channels, false ad online and old worn out paint. And concrete picnic areas outside were crumbling, ice machine broken, waited for iron after people checked out, room key didn't work, one elevator, phone inoperable so I had to walk downstairs to talk to disinterested person at front desk. Ad on line said they were 2 miles from stadium but more like 7 miles, nothing nearby for food, abandoned buildings nearby, only thing good was the price for the weekend(spring break). But we had same price in dec in Vegas at a nice hotel!!! Do not stay here unless you are desperate!!! We thought it might have been a gem undercover but it was a total dump.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but cheap for Miami”
Reviews.Author: JDWatson
Reviews.Content: The room & hotel is very basic. Seems like all luxuries have been removed to save the money. No bed side lamps which makes the room very dark in the evening (only one tall lamp). Only 2 bath towels (no bath mat, hand towels, etc). Shower is basically dripping so it takes three times longer to wash. No wireless internet in the rooms (I'm pressuming due to the additional cost to boost the signal) however Wifi available in the lobby. Ironing board in the room but no iron. When the room was cleaned and bedding changed, the pillowcase was too small for the pillow. I actually couldn't believe they would leave it like that (see pictures). Breakfast is very poor too, cereal, milk, coffee, one type of bagel, dried up pastries. Swimming pool and one of the elevators was not working. The reception guy was nice and polite. If you just need a bed to sleep in (literally) then you can get that, but even that's questionable.

Reviews.Title: “The nightmare ever”
Reviews.Author: aaronshi
Reviews.Content: I hate strongly hotwire to put this hotel into the list and give it a two star, that's totally cheating! I know I can't get refund but the truth is, I checked in the hotel and then immediately I rebook another hotel (finally Marriot Residence Inn) for that night through priceline so I paid two hotels during that day. This hotel is like what you see from black gangster's movie where those drug dealer like to stay. Bad service, no internet at room, all are dirty and smelling, only one lamp at room making you feel scared when stepping in, dirty sheet at all, etc. The guests there are looking weird also. So get smarter, don't bid or buy if you don't know what hotel you gonna get. That's why I almost not use hotwire any more. Living here is silly! You might get shot or robbed.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was so disgusting, I wouldn't let my dog stay there.....”
Reviews.Author: mobleyjake01
Reviews.Content: My firend and I booked this hotel because she had a business seminar that weekend, we were told that this was a family atmosphere area with restraunts and mall within walking distance, as well as a great place to stay and that it was in a good area. I have news for you...as soon as we got to the door to walk in we were asked if we had any marijuana we wanted to sell and what our rm. number was...as soon as we walked in the door the smell was so bad....they had a sign on the front desk that the pool was out of service, and we were told that there was a pool for use, and there was also a sign on the front desk about not ordering food from people. we got up too the rm. reluctantly and people had there doors open and hanging in the halls. when we opened the door, well you can imagine,...white stains all over carpet, holes in the furniture and everything was dirty and tv,. from the 70's, and the bathroom was disgusting, well there was no way we felt safe enough to stay there, especially 2 white females in that horrible area with drugs being sold there....the police were there and everything. we called the number we made the reservation through and they said we couldn't get our money back. so I called today and am waiting for an answer on that as we speak. This place needs to be shut down, and people shouldn't lie about what they have to offer to people that aren't familiar with the Miami area at all....We left and went to another hotel near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For deal hunters, an economical place to rest after a day's driving tour.”
Reviews.Author: bukangliwayway
Reviews.Content: This hotel could have been a beautiful place at one time. It looks very old and needs a facelift to make it at least a 3 star hotel. We only sleep here after driving around Miami and Fort Lauderdale. We stayed here for four nights and we find the room clean with good airconditioning. Our room was cleaned daily, towels and sheets changed daily as well. It was quiet and the clerks were friendly and helpful. We can only view few channels in the room TV but we only watch the news and the weather. For the price, I have nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Mischeviously Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Fionna_10
Reviews.Content: The quality of the place was poor for the fee. The area was not good, the rooms/building were poorly maintained, there were dust on lamps, stained in rug and tub, one would have to sign out towels, never enough for the quantity of guest in room. The conversations and noise was very noticeble between the walls. The breakfast was terrible, there was flies around it from a trash can near by and the server started to remove the stuff in front of people still getting food, very rude. Please choose a more family oriented place. This palce seemed like a rundown MOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible,not close to beach,bad service bad service”
Reviews.Author: drjoyedwards
Reviews.Content: First off this is not a boutique hotel or a resort!!! Second there is no bell man and the housekeeping is horrible. we arrived to an unvaccumed room with stains in the tub and no towels. then the door wouldnt lock. They then moved us to another room and it wouldnt lock either. I asked for a refund and they said i had to wait until the next day. the next day they told me they would not refund my money. the heater fell apart when i went to shut it on. the customer service was horrible and the only thing it is close to is the strip club king of diamonds. the beach is 20 mins away... buyer beware

Reviews.Title: “[--] scam. thanks hotwire”
Reviews.Author: guatechapin
Reviews.Content: I was comming from the crown plaza hotel in sawgrass mills, but next morning we were going to jump on a celebrity cruise, so we decided to move closer to miami port. my god, this place was so bad, that i even got on a fight with mt girlfrend for booking this dump. there is a big difference between modest and dirty,old,smelly,dump. i was so afraid to sleep in it, but it was late and we were going to leave early. we never un packed and stay with our close on ,on top of the covers, then waited to board the ship to shower

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT”
Reviews.Author: leraindrops
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin...The reviews for this hotel was horrible. After speaking with Hotwire Rep, decided to give them a chance, plus I could not change my hotel due to Hotwire policy of NO CHANGES, but ordered a rating review. I mean everything in "BAD" REVIEWS WAS CORRECT & as recent as 2010 - January; 2009 - Dec, Nov, Oct, Sept, Etc.. The location great; lobby & check in "OKAY". The elevator and ice machine that was broken for the past 6 months or more is still broken. One working elevator is about to breakdown. The smell in the hallway and room was horrible. There was trash everywhere. Let's just say I have pictures of MY ROOM showing not only dirty, but NASTY ROOM! Telephone plugged in room doesn't work; no alarm clock! Because of bad reviews, I brought my own sheets, cover, & towels, GLAD I DID! Asked manager for clean bedding, housekeeper stated they would look but there was none, never seen or heard from him again. There was "hair" all over the sheets when the covers were pulled back as if someone had just got off the bed. Sheets did't fit bed; walls, floors, pillow cases, & the mattresses had large stains. I almost forgot, roaches! I mean housekeeping was looking at us crazy as we were fighting to get roaches out of our room and this was at check in. Needless to say, we slept with our clothes on, on OUR sheets. This was not a 2 1/2 star rating hotel. I could have stayed at a cheaper hotel and had a better stay and cleaner room! Free Internet only works in lobby, so you had twenty people sitting in small lobby trying to use their laptops. Television in room (old) is in color (three vertical) blue yellow and green!

Reviews.Title: “Mold, dust, stains”
Reviews.Author: blndbeachlver18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through hotwire and after reading the reviews we tried to switch hotels but hotwire wouldn't help so we decided to try and stick it out, figuring "how bad could it be" Well we walked in and it smelled horrible, there was mold on the shower curtain and thick dust covering the lamps, head boards, dressers, etc, and stains on bed spread and sheets among a bug or two that we saw....gross... and management did nothing. even after complaining again to hotwire they still wouldn't reimburse our money or get us into another hotel but we dealt with the loss and checked into a different hotel. Do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible,,frightened,,smelly,,the area is spooky..”
Reviews.Author: bob3535
Reviews.Content: i happened to book this hotel through hotwire.com which i am really liking a lot,,,the first time i went to this hotel to check in,,,man,,trust me,,when i was entering the hotel itself ,,,it was scary,,the exteriors of the hotel are not painted for ages,,there were 4-5 american flags on the outside,,nd it seems no one takes care of them,,,they are all dusted..and the walls have cracks in them,,there are harldy 2-3 cars(there are around 100 odd rooms,,nd only 2-3 cars in the lot???)..now when i entered into the hotel,,,the carpets smelled bad,,the interiors are dark and scary...then i went into the room to see that,,theres no fridge,,no microwave..a troubled tv...grossest restrooms..the potty was dirty..eewww..and there was only one microwave for the entire floor(which has around 30 odd rooms..i sure cant cook my food in that...ewwww)...overall,,plz ...plzzzz ,,trust me,,,don stay here,,don book ur beutifull days in miami here....go elsewhere... luckily for me,,the hotwire ppl changed the booking...for me.. roma golden glades...suck big time....

Reviews.Title: “Give me my money back!”
Reviews.Author: yiannis35
Reviews.Content: Please! close the place down. Rooms NOT clean! toilet not working. at 2 15 pm we had to wait to check in with only 6 cars on the parking lot. Not a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like ROME or ROMA!!”
Reviews.Author: Ngrabella
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be my favorite when it was known as El Palacio. Ive been frequenting Miami for years now always booking there. My troubles started with reserving and paying for a room on the second or above floor. Nope didnt happen, I was placed with no room for questions on the first loud noisy floor across the hall from housekeeping Okay- the room was rank and smelled of filth. The bed was worn. There was patches on the bathroom ceiling of undone drywall (leaks) repair. The tub was worn and in need of a facelift. No room service. The bar/restaraunt was closed down out of business leaving you to travel to find food. The snack machine was no better- I purchased a snack that was open and took it to the front desk to let them know. The girl behind the counter-rude-dont care attitude replied promptly by saying there is nothing she can do. And ive book a room for how much!!! Room service came at 3:30 the next day!! I was mad and she so called cleaned by sweeping the carpet with a broom, placing dingy sheets on my worn bed- no paper toilet, no smell good in the air, no nothing and left the trash in the bins. Nastiness. The outside does not look anything like in the fotos---thats what it used to look like LYES LIES. The roman statues had mildew growing on the them, the trees and bushes were unkept. Its poorly lit bad outside. The landscape-WHAT landscape. I hated everymoment I was there. I was there from August 14 thru Aug 17 2009 in room 105.- And I dont recommend this krappy MOTEL to anyone. Its a fake with poor quality and poor customer service. And the pool was gross in need of some serious filtration-

Reviews.Title: “everything about the hotel was a disaster”
Reviews.Author: ericDenver_Colorado
Reviews.Content: So many things were so bad, I don't know where to start. The beds were terribly swaybacked, any movement and they creaked awfully, and the "fitted" sheets never fit, on either bed, the entire week: They were too small, and would come off the mattress the moment you laid down. Neither the tub nor the sink would hold water, seriously. The whole place was falling apart, I was afraid to get into the elevator, it was so jerky. The TV service looked awful, and very few channels were available. The internet service only worked from the lobby, not from your room. The continental breakfast, well forget it, and most of the hotel was an unused ghost town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: chely12500
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. I have to say that I was a little nervous booking this hotel after reading some of the negative reviews on this website but I took my chances. Being the Winter Music Conference Weekend it was hard to find a Hotel with such a great rate as this one. Upon checking in I was very surprised. The room looked exactly like in the pictures. It was very clean and organized. The bathroom was very clean and maintained. The jacuzzi was great. The pool area was very nice and clean with all the statues and garden look. The Hotel was not in a bad area as mentioned, the area was actually very quiet. The restaurant closes early. Not much around so you need a car to get around. South Beach and MIA are bout 15 minutes away. There is a rt.441 close by about 5 minutes. You will find anything you need there. Food, Gas, pharmacy, etc. I would definately stay at this hotel again. The service and hotel staff were great and overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience in every facet”
Reviews.Author: trickangle
Reviews.Content: This was both one of the worst and most bizarre hotels I have ever stayed at. The grounds look beautiful on the outside, complete with dozens of renaissance-style statues. But that is where the pleasantness ends. The inside of the hotel is rundown, dirty and lacking in security. Service was terrible. I would not recommend this hotel to my enemy. My wife and I thought we were getting a steal for about $115 a night for a room with a whirlpool. Wow, were we wrong! The room had numerous stains on the ceiling. It smelled very musty and reeked of cleaning chemicals. We opened the window to air it out, which helped, but the bathroom never lost its rank odor. (We prebooked three nights -- big mistake!) Each additional night we stayed there, the more stains I noticed in the room. There was gum stuck on the bed's headboard along with various carvings from prior guests. Basically, the room looked as if it hadn't been maintained at all for at least a year. But the condition of the room was just the beginning of our problems. The hotel is in a very bad part of town and nowhere near any attractions. I found it bizarre that this supposedly high-end hotel was located in such a poor area with no other hotels anywhere nearby. Worst of all, though, is the utter lack of security. We heard loud fights in rooms nearby. One night about 5 or 6 young men who appeared to be gang members sat down in the middle of the hallway near our room and stayed there for several hours, with no appearance by management. Late at night it was the norm to encounter shady characters wandering the hotel hallways. We started propping a chair in front of our door at night. To add to the nightmare, the lock on the room door was faulty and did not always lock when it closed, so when leaving we had to fiddle with it until it locked. Amazingly, even the poor security was not the worst part of our experience! The worst part was the utter lack of cleaning service. No one performed any cleaning whatsoever during our three-day stay. Our second night we had to call the front desk three times just to get some clean towels and sheets. The third night we decided not to even bother. The absolute worst of all was the dingy fitted bedsheet we were forced to use during our stay. It was so worn out that it constantly pulled off the mattress so that I woke up 5 or 6 times every night to the pleasant sensation of bare mattress under my skin (and God only knows what nastiness was on that mattress, given the dinginess of the rest of the room). We ended up using some pins we had brought with us to pin the sheet to the mattress, but even that did not work very well. I have never stayed at a hotel that did not even have a sheet that fit the mattress. Lastly, there was no Internet access in the rooms. To gain access, you had to take your computer down to the lobby, navigating the unsafe hallways with a $2,000 computer in hand. The only positive to our stay was that the whirlpool worked adequately, but we hardly used it because of the revolting condition of the rest of the room. Even the continental breakfast was subpar and poorly stocked. We didn't use the pool, but it looked dirty. We felt fortunate that our car wasn't broken into during our stay. Don't be fooled by pictures of the outside of this hotel. Perhaps in its prime this was a nice place to spend a weekend, but in the present day it is dingy and neglected. Do whatever it takes to stay far, far away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: royj
Reviews.Content: i have sent a complaint to Expedia about this hotel and a review after they sent me an e-mail asked if i would review the hotel,i told them that the place looks nice from the outside and the young lady who checked us in was pleasent and very helpful,but after that oh dear,both Expedia and the hotels own website describe the corporate king room has having large screen tv`s,in-room safes,clock radios,irons,hair dryers,the corporate king we had was lacking in all these items,the small telly had 39 channels but only 20 had a watchable picture,the in-room safe was a hole in the carpet,no clock radio,no iron or ironing board,but to be fair there is no mention of a ironing board anyway,there was on the wall a holder for a iron,as for the hair dryer no sign of one of them either,the bottom sheet on the bed ended up in the middle of the bed on both nights because it was so small,the two men we spoke to at reception were just there to hold the seat from floating away,we asked one if the little havana area in miami was ok to visit and he kept going on about some restaurant with the same name,then it was breakfast time,being english we liked to have a drink of tea with our breakfast(not too much to ask is it)but no hot water never mind any tea bags,when my wife asked about this she was told the hotel has nothing to do with breakfast and should talk to the catering contractor about this,i read there was no place to eat close by but did not expect to have to travel so far to see anywhere to eat,if you are going to Miami either spend less money or more money and stay somewhere other than this place!.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: KC001
Reviews.Content: First things first. This Hotel should have a restaurant. There is nothing and I mean nothing in the area. That would be the only negative I would have . The grounds and the rooms where very clean and the staff was great. They made me and my family feel like we where at home. We received a welcome email when we made our reservation and a thank you emial the day after we checked out. Nice touch! We stayed four days, by the second day, the staff knew my kids by their first names. This Hotel is truely a diamond in the rough. I would imagine that a Hotel like this on the beach would be a better fit. We enjoyed our stay and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Rediculous”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueenMissouri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. They never put toilet paper or towels in the room haf to go to front desk for everything. They never cleaned the room the phone did not work. and two days into the stay before we realized the door wouldn't lock. When they decided to change that door wouldn't lock either. The pool was dirty. Safe in room didn't work. Maintence man said room was not to be listed as available since door didn't work. Breakfast was horrible. They wouln't even refund any of the monies spent on the room. It also smelled like mildrew. In conclusion stay at this hotel at yor on risk someone might walk in on you.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little run down, but still cheap”
Reviews.Author: Jason72
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here in the past, must say the place seemed more run down. First room the A/C wasn't working and the latch lock was broken, so had to get another room. Second room needed a new light bulb for the bed lamp, and the safe needed new batteries to work. While staff was quick to fix this, you would expect this stuff to be done before hand. Maintenance guy said they were short handed. Hallway carpeting had noticable stains. Room furniture/carpeting a bit run down and musty and I didn't want to put my clothes in the dresser. If you stay here, bring the wet-wipes to sanitize the furniture and wear slippers inside. Positives: cheap budget room rate during Spring Break season (even after silly resort fee). Bathroom/towels/bedding reasonably clean. Free continental breakfast, but get there early or they start to run out of stuff. There's a Subway (sandwich) shop a block away in the office park next door that's really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate , Great Satff!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieNewYork
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel for Spring Break. I had never heard of the Hotel so I was not sure what to expect. The rate was excelllant so I was not really expecting much. However, the staff was great, the rate was great and service was very friendly. The staff seemed to be of all different nationalities which was cool for me being from New York. All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: apattcpa
Reviews.Content: We had never heard of this Hotel but we found the roomsto be nicer than we expected and the staff was very friendly. They went out of their way to be sure we where taken care of. There is not much to see in the area so be prepared to drive atlas 10 to 15 minutes to the Beach or other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “NO Security BAD”
Reviews.Author: Zus-5
Reviews.Content: BAD AREA - We stayed on Christmas & our car was broken into. This hotel does not have good security and is in a very bad area. DO NOT STAY unless you have alarm on your car. Nice rooms, but we will NEVER stay here again, because of safety reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: shatiyask
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Elpalacio for my vacation as a getaway, big mistake. Problem #1, the remote control for the television did not work. They finally responded to the problem 3 hours later and offered to switch my room, which was not an opinion because I had already unpacked. Problem #2 when I went to turn on the AC I noticed that there where ants crawling on top of the unit. Problem #3 At about 9:45am housekeeper enter my room while I was in bed. When she noticed I was there she ran out of the room. I recieved a knock at my door around 11:00am by another housekeeping to clean the room. I then asked the housekeeper if she could give me 5 minutes, because I was on my way out and she said yes. When I exited the room, she appeared to be entering the room to clean, but when I returned at 2:30pm the room was still in the same condition which made me angry because I had returned to the room to rest. I immediately came out and approached another housekeeper, who informed that she was sending someone right away. I waited for another 45 minutes, still no one. I then went to the front desk where a gentleman gave me, the guest, directions to housekeeping so that I could inquire on my behalf because he was too busy on the phone. He should have been the one to resolve the matter. Finally the housekeeper returned to the room to give fresh towels and empty the garbage pails, were left empy. She left a roll of gabage bags on the bathroom sink, I guess that was for me to do. Overall, I did not care for the service that I recieved. The room had an odor ( it's a good thing I brought the febreeze), and next time I think I'll spend the extra money and get something decent because this hotel was far from it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway at the El Palacio Boutique & Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in El Palacio, we rented a queen jacuzzi suite. At our arrival, the staff was very friendly and eager to assist our every need. The suite was amazing. The jacuzzi is located just steps away from your bed where you can enjoy the comfort of relaxing in the hot water and watching television! We paid in total $130 for our nights stay, but it was worth every penny. This is the perfect place to stay and get away from everyday's hassels and spend quality time with your loved ones. There is plenty to do at El Palacio, there is a pool for those who love to swim, a cafeteria for those late night cravings, and their own sports bar is you are looking to watch a game or just hang out without even leaving the hotel. I encourage everyone to stay atleast one night to see what magical getaway you will have!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, actually”
Reviews.Author: mikeLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be the best of the budget-priced hotels near Miami. Nice enough to host occasional wedding parties, it still falls a little short of the label "boutique hotel". Still, the rooms are clean, spacious and new-looking. Some ticky-tacky decorating touches, plus the exterior Grecian motif, may be someone else's taste but not mine. The staff must have thought they were employed at a Four Seasons, because I saw them treat everyone at the front desk with courtesy and politeness. The biggest negative is the location. Situated at a confluence of too many freeways, and a victim of Miami's insane street numbering system, it is easy to get lost. So remember this: whichever direction you are going on the 95, exit at 826-WEST. 12th AVE is the first offramp, and the hotel is just on the right. The area is purely industrial, with plenty of buildings with names like "ACME Plastics". There really is nowhere to eat within 4 miles or so (except at the hotel). OVERALL: Value: A Location: C

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Renea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Palacio Boutique Hotel in March 2006. As soon as I drove up to this hotel, I began a wonderful experience. Since I did not have many bags, I opted to bring my bags in myself. A worker from the hotel came to my car and took my bags from my car to my room. The check in was fast and easy. The rooms were much better than I expected. Very easy access to I-95. All the workers in the hotel were very friendly. It was a very positive experience staying here. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for 10 nights. We arrived at 1 pm after 9 hours flight and asked to check in. Prompt answer:"not before 3 pm" .That's it ! So we went for a coffee and came back early evening. Our double king size room was not available , so we were "upgraded "to a single king size. Ok for me but when we came in the room I noticed it was situated on the side were the motorway passes at 50m.Traffic 24 hours guaranteed ! An example of intelligent coordination when you know people are going to stay for 10 nights. So the day after we asked for another room on the other side. Which was not a problem.Quiet room , nice , we thought....But ..! Another intelligent move was made by the front desk manager , assigning the rooms left, right and in front of me to group of unrespectful youngsters. Shouting, screaming, banging on the walls , using language according to their "education " I went to complain and understood I had to accept this. It was all normal due to spring break. Let them party !! The same night at 1 am we packed and ran from this hotel (read:"hell" ) never again ! Though..My appreciation goes to 2 people working in this hotel. Thank you Danny and Amanda for your help. You deserve better

Reviews.Title: “Average-but cheap”
Reviews.Author: Tripper74
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. We booked it through their website at what we thought was $59 a night. The number of taxes and fees on every little thing was unbelievable. Taxes are expected but there were lots of hidden costs making the 2 night stay more like $75 a night. We also were disappointed with the restaurant. They boasted all over the place about their fabulous breakfast buffet. When we went down on Sunday morning, the restaurant acted like they had never heard of it. The staff was not too helpful on that either. Okay hotel, cheap, but watch out for hidden costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I where very happy with our stay. We originally booked at another Hotel. That Hotel "lost" our reservation so they referred us to El Palacio. It turned out to be a great deal. We received a suite with huge wide screen tv and a jacuzzi for the same price we where paying for a basic roomat the fist Hotel. Very nicely done El Palacio. Oh yea. the restaurant was incredible with the plasma tvs and the NFL ticket. My wife kids checked out the malls while I was in NFL heaven with all the ganes playing at once. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Jacuzzi is a nice touch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited the El Palacio Boutique Hotel this past weekend and I found the entire place outside and in to be suprisingly nice. I reserved my stay over the internet. When I arrived, I was told that the my room was not ready and that I would be upgraded at no extra charge. Very nice. When I got my room, there it was. A jacuzzi. That was a real suprise and a very nice touch. I enjoyed my stay. The Jacuzzi was GREAT and the new restaurant is amazing. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay with El Placio was better than I expected. I decided to give the Hotel a try after seeing a promotion sponsored by the Hotel. The Hotel was a pleasant surprise for me. I enjoyed the pool area and the rooms where larger than normal. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. This Hotel was a very interesting surprise. We would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Rotting cesspool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: cio over other hotels in the area because the website stated it was "new". When we arrived we found out that it was once a condemned hotel and was "refurbished" by the new owners. So we decided to give it a try. The first room we checked into was a no smoking room. This was funny because it reeked of smoke. So we asked to move. The next room was just as awful. There was mildew all over the tiles and bathtub. We again asked to be moved but this time my father and I checked out the rooms before we once again moved all of our families stuff. We went through 3 nasty rooms before we found one suitable. We wouldn't have stayed except that it was late, the neighborhood not so great and the fact that we were only going to be there for one night. In my own opinion this is one to skip!

Reviews.Title: “A silk purse from a cow's ear?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The remodeled El Palacio begs the proverbial question can you make a silk purse from a cow's ear. Rooms are cramped but clean, suites are not suites but rooms with more stuff crammed in them and a small patio. The crammed jacuzzi rooms are a unique but mixed plus, and service borders on criminal.

Reviews.Title: “Completely awful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was fooled by the beautiful pictures! The resort is not "new"...it's an old remodeled Ramada Inn far from the beach and in a terrible part of town. The staff was completely unprofessional. We were actually handed a plunger when our toilet overflowed! The MVP Bar and Grill on the first floor is more like dumpy gangster club, complete with live rappers and expensive cars?? We were suckered in by the "new introductory rate" of $49.99/night. Well, with all the bed charges??...and safe charges???...it ended up being at least $70/night! Traveling in miami, we saw so many nicer places offering better rates (these places were not found online when I was trip planning!).To top it off...one month later, now march...I find out that someone has been using my debit card number, expiration date, and home address to make charges in Northern Miami. This hotel is the only place in Miami that had access to all of this information while we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say I enjoyed my stay. When I first checked in I opted for a standard room. I then changed my mind and decided to upgrade to the jacuzzi suite. The staff were very professional and courteous about the change and made it go smooth. I just wanted to get away for a couple of days and this was one of my most enjoyable hotel experiences. I will go back soon and have reconmmended this hotel to all of my friends and business associates!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “wedding bliss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I decided to get married we wanted a lovely location to have the wedding reception. The hotel was new then, as we got married november,99. The owner at the time , who passed away a couple years back was just the best....everywhere was just beautiful and a lovely setting. We ended up not using the banquet hall of hotel as our guest list got longer and used El palacio banquet halls, which has now closed unfortunately. However our guest would stay there and I blocked of several rooms. I also decided to spend the night before my wedding there and all my bridesmaids and it was lovely....We got a free limo service to the church and reception site compliments of the hotel. My husband and I also stayed in the jacuzzi suite for our honeymoon and the hotel employee's made that a pleasurable stay also. I love the hotel and hope that they keep up the good work it's nice to have a hotel in the area so beautiful.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Roma Golden Glades Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 16805 NW 12th Ave, Miami, FL 33169
